title: The hills of home,
author: Watt, Lauchlan McLean.
snippet: He had the memorizing eye of the artist,  which carries away in one glance all that it sees, and which appeals, as though with visual music, to the heart. One sees that, in his letter to Crockett, where he speaks of Glencorse Kirk— the quiet cruciform structure which figures in Weir of Hermiston. "Do you know where the road crosses the burn under Glencorse Church?
